text: RT @davemh72: @EnvAgencyMids @InvasiveSp What about invasive gasses ? you've done precious little to stop them in North Staffordshire . #re‚Ä¶

@N_Rivers_Trust @GlavenEel @theriverstrust @EnvAgencyAnglia So envious of your eels! That's what I was hoping to see.  Wondered if they might be more abundant upstream of the bridge at Bayfield, whereas I only went downstream.  Also wondered if the weird absence of sticklebacks could have been caused by heavy rain washing them downstream?

@Happy_Mapper @WildTroutTrust @N_Rivers_Trust @EnvAgency @The_WMA @NENorfolkSufflk @AnglianWater @WestNorfolkBC Hopefully Charles Rangeley-Wilson will be out there plotting it‚Äôs old course with his stick. Check out the film on @WhoOwnsNorfolk @joe_crowley interviews Charles about the fantastic restoration on the river Nar at West Acre @WildWestacre üôèsave the Gaywood River https://t.co/AVS0iTWzlG

@GlavenEel @N_Rivers_Trust @theriverstrust @EnvAgencyAnglia I wonder if the otter has made the trout very nervous?The 5 or 6 small fish that whizzed by - as singles - heading both up & down stream over the course of my  hour or two in the water, were most likely trout. But there was no gentle hanging out together like on rivers further S.
